bill_title: to prohibit the possession of certain articles in a jail or juvenile detention facility, to prohibit the delivery of certain articles to a jail or juvenile detention facility, and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit the possession of certain articles in a jail or juvenile detention facility, to prohibit the delivery of certain articles to a jail or juvenile detention facility, and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 24-11-47 be amended to read as follows: 24-11-47. No alcoholic beverages, controlled substances as defined by chapter 34-20B, hallucinogens, marijuana, or weapons as defined in subdivision 22-1-2(10), may be possessed by any inmate of a jail or juvenile detention facility . No prescription or nonprescription drugs may be possessed by any inmate of a jail or juvenile detention agency except by order of a physician. Such order shall be in writing and for a definite period. No contraband as established and noticed by the institution may be possessed by any inmate of a jail or juvenile detention facility. A violation of this section constitutes a felony crime pursuant to the following schedule: (1) Possession of contraband as established and noticed by the institution is a Class 1 misdemeanor; (1) (2) Possession of alcoholic beverages or marijuana is a Class 6 felony; (2) (3) Possession of prescription or nonprescription drugs, controlled substances , or hallucinogens is a Class 4 felony; (3) (4) Possession of a weapon as defined in subdivision 22-1-2(10) is a Class 2 felony. Section 2. That § 24-11-48 be amended to read as follows: 24-11-48. No employee or other person may deliver or procure to be delivered, or have in such person's possession with intent to deliver, to any inmate in a jail or juvenile detention facility , or deposit or conceal in or around any jail or juvenile detention facility , or in any mode of transport entering the grounds of any jail or juvenile detention facility and its ancillary facilities used to house inmates, any article or thing contrary to § 24-11-47 with intent that any inmate obtain or receive the same. A violation of this section is a Class 6 felony.
